intro: Rhinanthus alectorolophus var. modestus, commonly known as the modest common tickseed, is a herbaceous annual plant native to Europe. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family, which includes many parasitic and semi-parasitic species. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as grasslands, heaths, and woodland edges. Its flowers are yellow and tubular, with two lips, and it produces small, dry fruits called capsules. It is often found in disturbed soils and is known for its ability to thrive in nutrient-poor environments.
